values: You are surprised when something unexpected happens.
He didn’t appear at all surprised when he read the article.
adj. 感到惊奇的;表示震惊的
adj. 感到惊奇的;表示震惊的
adj.惊奇的,惊讶的,觉得奇怪的,感觉意外的
惊讶, 吃惊, 诧异, 惊 (adj.); 感到惊讶, 惊奇, 感到意外, 大吃一惊 (verb.)
v. 使惊奇（surprise的过去分词形式）
To surprise is to cause someone to feel a sudden sense of astonishment or disbelief, often by doing something unexpected or out of the ordinary.
